thread.title: Former team mates Lineker and Shilton split on Brexit - and Theresa May - Leicestershire Live

author: Dan Martin
title: Former team mates Lineker and Shilton split on Brexit - and Theresa May - Leicestershire Live
text:
Lineker and Shilton before the 1986 World Cup Get Daily
They’re Leicester City legends and former England team mates but it appears Gary Lineker and Peter Shilton are poles apart in politics and on Brexit.
The former keeper took to Twitter to tell his 35,000 followers of his admiration for arch-Brexiteer Jacob Rees-Mogg yesterday as Tory MPs prepared to vote on whether to keep Theresa May as Prime Minister. Peter Shilton (Photo by The FA/The FA via Getty Images)
Shilton had been watching Mr Rees-Mogg in many interviews and tweeted: “He really knows what he is talking about and puts it across in a calm and calculated manner!”
The striker, an outspoken critic of Brexit, fired back an emoji driven response with a grimacing face saying: “What’s that old saying? You should never see a tweet from your heroes?” Gary Lineker presents Match of the Day
Lineker was not the only footballer to take issue with the stopper’s tweet.
His former Everton and England teammate Peter Reid said: “I’ll agree to disagree on that one Goalie. He’s loopy, doesn’t know his arse from his elbow.“ Read More
